conclusion: To determine the work done by the gas, analyze the area enclosed by the cycle on the P-V diagram.
Work done by the gas is positive if the cycle is traversed in a clockwise direction.
A→B is an isochoric process with volume at 2 L.
B→C is an isobaric process with pressure decreasing from 4×10⁵ Pa to 1×10⁵ Pa.
C→A is an isochoric process with volume at 5 L.
A→B: Work done W_AB = 0 because volume does not change.
B→C: Work done W_BC calculated using average pressure and change in volume.
C→A: Work done W_CA = 0 because volume does not change.
Total work done W_total = W_AB + W_BC + W_CA = 7.5 × 10^5 J.
The work done by the gas on the surroundings is 7.5 × 10^5 Joules.
